Yo bro!
Did you or anyone get hurt or something?
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54faa4ad63687229a07a0900#post_54faa4ad63687229a07a0900

"@SidewardManatee":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54faa4d76368723d5e6f0d00#post_54faa4d76368723d5e6f0d00

"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54faa5576368723d5e8d0d00#post_54faa5576368723d5e8d0d00

I'm fine now since I had some time.

But what happened was, just a few hours ago, My brothers Dog. 

The Dog that I knew since I was *5/6 years old*. just Got hit by a car and died.

I knew that guy for my whole life. We got him when my Brother graduated from school. 

!http://fc08.deviantart.net/fs71/f/2012/196/6/2/big_boss__s_salute___mgs3_by_rainedrebellion-d57boh0.gif!
He was the best dog I have ever known. and was a family member to us all.

May he rest in peace.
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54faa56f63687229a0fa0900#post_54faa56f63687229a0fa0900
I'm not gonna say it'll be alright. It won't. That kind of thing hurts. A LOT. And it's okay to cry. Just know that he loved you and you loved him. And that we love you.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54faa56f63687229a0fa0900#post_54faa56f63687229a0fa0900
That's...
Oh shit man.

I know that feel when my cousin's dog died.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54faa56f63687229a0fa0900#post_54faa56f63687229a0fa0900

topics.author: 51a2815b7f123be59500049b

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54faa5e36368724b7fe91000#post_54faa5e36368724b7fe91000

"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54faa6126368721a55551c00#post_54faa6126368721a55551c00

"@SidewardManatee":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54faa6c26368727fbccb0e00#post_54faa6c26368727fbccb0e00

I've shed a lot of tears tonight.

You see. I was the one that actually found him because when I was out looking for him I heard a loud *YELP* sound and after that I already assumed the worst. 

I found these nice people putting him on the grass to the side of the road and they put a little shirt over his head. 

So I carried him back home for the last time. 

But, You know I'm not crying anymore. He lived a great life and he was with a family that loved him just as much as he loved us. 

He was very old, fact the vet said he actually LIVED PAST the normal life ratio  for a German Shepherd. 

He was a amazing Dog and I'm just glad we found him and that he is at peace now.
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54faa82563687259a6040c00#post_54faa82563687259a6040c00
The people said that it was reported and the cops should have the license plate. 

"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54faa82563687259a6040c00#post_54faa82563687259a6040c00
Thank you.

Yeah its sad but He's sitting in good ole Doggy heaven now! Chewing on bones and has his old young body again for the ladies!

He was a ladies man after all! Rest in peace you handsome man. 


"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54faa886636872501afa1800#post_54faa886636872501afa1800
Nah man its cool. I'm feeling better now. like I said he's at pace now.

Was it really an accident?

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54faa95363687246bf931300#post_54faa95363687246bf931300
I'm glad you're OK now.
I used to have a cat that was pretty much family.

He died to due poison. I blame the neighbour but my dad said that it's OK. He didn't even like the place we lived at ever since we moved.

He lived a good 10 years.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54faaa0663687250c2710c00#post_54faaa0663687250c2710c00
Yeah like I said the people that found him were just in the midst of Taking him to the side of the road when they found him. I just so happen to fined them and him RIGHT at that very moment when they were moving him out of off the street. 

They told me they didn't want people to hit him.

I don't know who those folks are but all of my respect for that. They did the right thing and moved him to a safer place.
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

topics.body: ...I have nothing to add but "Sorry for the loss" (Sorry.)

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54faacbc6368726c54b21800#post_54faacbc6368726c54b21800
I know how that feels. Its either move to a place and not have any friends there or one of your few friends you know moves away sadly.

I had some friends I knew for a while move away. It stinks. 


"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54faad376368722cbaae0400#post_54faad376368722cbaae0400
It is really saddening when a pet passes away after all that time. 

But I'll be fine

At least he is at rest now. And for all the other pets that pass they are also at peace now too.

He comes back every once in a while and it's kinda a happy reunion for all of us.
